name: The Burned Map
one_liner: Her brother's last map—half destroyed, the half that remains might be worse
_one_liner_note: Overwrite as understanding of object evolves.

status.current_condition: Fragile but whole. Handled too often at the folds.

current.specific: In her satchel, oiled leather sleeve

history.note: Kael glimpsed it—first sign of his interest

description._note: Physical description mostly static. Note changes in status.history.
description.physical: A large parchment, folded into quarters, edges charred black. The left half is illegible—burned in the workshop fire. The right half shows coastline, mountains, and a path leading to a symbol she doesn't recognize. The ink is her father's. The annotations are her brother's.
description.condition_details: Brittle at the edges. Soft where worn from handling. Kept in an oiled leather sleeve.
distinguishing_features: Burn marks follow a diagonal—fire moved corner to corner
Brother's handwriting in margins: coordinates, dates, question marks
A symbol at the path's end: circle with three lines through it

sensory._note: Relatively stable. Append if new sensory details revealed.
sensory.sight: Yellowed parchment, black char, faded brown ink that was once deep red
sensory.touch: Brittle at the edges, soft where worn from handling
sensory.smell: Old smoke that never quite faded, leather from the sleeve, something faintly metallic
sensory.sound: Crinkles dangerously when unfolded—she holds her breath each time

current.practical_function: Map to an unknown location—her only lead to her brother
current.emotional_weight: Last physical connection to father and brother. Proof the fire didn't take everything. Now also proof her father had secrets.
current.symbolic_meaning: The past half-destroyed, the future unclear. Family secrets that burn but don't die.

significance.practical: Symbol matches standing stones—lead is real
significance.emotional: Father knew more than he said
